taste.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the feeling that is produced by a particular food or drink when you put it in your mouth
taste.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The medicine had a slightly bitter taste.
I don’t really like the taste of meat anymore.
taste.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the sense by which you know one food from another
taste.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Some birds have a highly developed sense of taste.
taste.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if you have a taste of some food or drink, you put a small amount in your mouth to try it
taste.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: You must have a taste of the fruitcake.
taste.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the kind of things that someone likes
taste.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: He asked about my taste in music.
While she was in France she developed a taste for fine wines.
taste.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: someone’s judgment when they choose clothes, decorations etc
taste.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Some people have really bad taste in clothes.
taste.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: the quality of being acceptable and not offensive
taste.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: All television companies accept the need to maintain standards of taste and decency.
She acknowledged her remark had been in bad taste.
taste.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: a short experience of something that shows you what it is like
taste.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: It gave him his first taste of acting for the big screen.
The autumn storms gave us a taste of what was to come  (=showed what would happen later).
Schoolchildren can get a taste of the countryside first-hand.
taste.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: the feeling that you have after an experience, especially a bad experience
taste.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: The way he spoke to those children left a nasty taste in my mouth.
taste.translation[0].note_box[0].section: delicious
The taste was absolutely delicious.
a delicious creamy taste
nasty/unpleasant
Some tablets have a nasty taste.
strange/odd/peculiar/funny
The sweets had a rather peculiar taste.
This cheese has quite a strong taste.
The taste of the leaves is milder than the root.
The fruits have an excellent sweet taste.
The brandy would not have masked the bitter taste of the poison.
sour
The purpose of the lemon’s sour taste may be to stop the fruit being eaten by animals.
salty
He was conscious of the salty taste of his own blood.
spicy
Add a little curry powder to give it a spicy taste.
creamy/buttery/fruity/nutty etc
The cookies had a very buttery taste.
bland
Some people find the taste of rice too bland.
distinctive
Hops give beer its distinctive bitter taste.
have a sweet/strange etc taste
The soup had a funny taste.
give something a taste
The spices gave the bread a rather interesting taste.
taste.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: the kind of things that someone likes
taste.translation[0].note_box[1].section: Their tastes in movies were very different.
He was a man of expensive tastes.
He was a man of simple tastes
Which one you choose is a question of personal taste.
The shop created a unique style of goods that appealed to the popular taste.
This kind of tea is an acquired taste, but very refreshing.
Changes in consumer tastes result in the expansion of some industries and the contraction of others.
Josh and I have the same tastes.
She certainly has a taste for adventure.
At university she developed a taste for performing.
You obviously share her taste in literature.
We have music to suit every taste.
The magazine caters for all tastes.
If her books are not to your taste, there are plenty of books by other writers.
be too bright/modern etc for somebody’s taste
The building was too modern for my taste.
something is a matter of taste
Which of the two methods you use is largely a matter of taste.
taste.translation[0].note_box[2].section: They had to eat revolting things, like fish eyes.
tasting good and with plenty of flavour
She cooked us a simple but tasty meal.
having a taste that stings your tongue slightly, like lemon does – used especially when this is rather unpleasant
The apples were a little sour.
The wine has rather a tart taste, which not everyone will like.
having a taste that stings your tongue slightly, like lemon does, in a way that seems good
The dressing was nice and tangy.
having a strong taste which is not sweet and is sometimes rather unpleasant – used for example about black coffee, or chocolate without sugar
The medicine had rather a bitter taste.
Hops give beer its distinctive bitter taste.
Danish salami has a salty flavour.
having a burning taste because it contains strong spices
a little spicy – used especially by people who write about food. This word can sound rather pretentious in everyday conversation
cooked vegetables in a piquant sauce
not having a strong or hot taste – usually used about foods that can sometimes be spicy
I found the sauce rather bland.
taste.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to have a particular kind of taste
taste.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The food tasted better than it looked.
It didn’t taste much of ginger.
It tastes just like champagne to me.
What does pumpkin taste like  (=how would you describe its taste)?
taste.translation[1].definitions[0].note: Taste is a linking verb in this meaning It links the subject of the sentence with an adjective
The verb taste is not usually used in the progressive You say
You often say someone can taste something when describing what they taste
The present participle tasting is used to form adjectives such as sweet-tasting and foul-tasting
taste.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to experience or recognize the taste of food or drink
taste.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: It was like nothing I’d ever tasted before.
taste.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to eat or drink a small amount of something to see what it is like
taste.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: It’s always best to keep tasting the food while you’re cooking it.
taste.translation[1].note_box[0].section: The apples weren’t very big but they tasted good.
These fruit drinks taste a bit funny until you get used to them.
He handed me some black stuff which tasted bitter.
The water tasted strongly of chlorine.
